Key Match Events: Boston Celtics scored the first 11 points of the fourth quarter to push their advantage to 93-72
The Celtics led by 10 after three and scored the first 11 points of the fourth quarter to pull away for their third straight victory
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics were playing without Jaylen Brown, who missed a second straight game with a shoulder strain
The Rockets started 38-year-old Jeff Green for the first time this season due to Jabari Smith Jr. breaking a bone in his hand
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Joe Mazzulla cleared the bench with Boston up by 21 points with about 4 1/2 minutes to go
The Celtics had no trouble handling Houston despite playing without Jaylen Brown
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kristaps Porzingis added 11 points with five rebounds in his return after missing four games with a sprained left ankle
The Rockets made just 32 of 88 shots with Green going 10 of 21 and Cam Whitmore making just 4 of 17
Others: Jalen Green had 27 points for the Rockets
Amen Thompson, the fourth pick in the 2023 draft, will fill in for Jabari Smith Jr. moving forward after finishing up a two-game suspension
